meanings.definition: Not able to be pacified or satisfied.
meanings.sent1: The toddler's unappeasable cries could be heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent2: The unappeasable hunger of the wolf drove it to hunt for food all night.
meanings.sent3: The unappeasable demands of the picky eater made dinner time a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her unappeasable desire for adventure led her to explore unknown lands.
meanings.sent5: The unappeasable storm raged on, refusing to calm down.

meanings.definition: Unable to be calmed or placated.
meanings.sent1: The unappeasable anger in his eyes made her take a step back.
meanings.sent2: The unappeasable fear in her heart kept her from sleeping peacefully.
meanings.sent3: The unappeasable excitement of the children on the playground was contagious.
meanings.sent4: His unappeasable curiosity drove him to ask endless questions.
meanings.sent5: The unappeasable waves crashed against the shore, relentless in their pursuit.
